definition: all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: He is all talk and no action.
But the gifted Daniel scholar shouldn't be an armchair strategist.
sentences.chinese: 不过你这个牛才子也不能光说不练吧。

sentences.english: Like Saif Gaddafi, Dr Sadiki says, Ibrahim spoke the language of democracy although "the practice is something else".
sentences.chinese: 像卡扎菲一样，他有着民主的言论，尽管光说不练。

sentences.english: All talk and no action is useless.
So that tells me they are all talks and no action.
sentences.chinese: 所以那个告诉我他们都是光说不练假把式。

sentences.english: Frieda: Baby, I think you're all yap and no zap.
sentences.chinese: 宝贝儿，我觉着你是光说不练啊。

definition: all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice
to be all talk and no action
(lit.) to fire blank shots/(fig.) to be all talk and no action/to shoot one's mouth off/to make empty promises
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
to boast/to talk big
to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
(idiom) to have a glib tongue/to talk big
(idiom) to say one thing and do another

lit. military tactics on paper (idiom)/fig. theoretical discussion that is worse than useless in practice/armchair strategist/idle theorizing/cf Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括 leading an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC
flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
nothing serious/just hot air
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
to play tricks/to dupe
